column5: Parts of western new york are getting pounded with some pretty serious lake effect snow as some of you southern ontarians may know.  You guys getting any up there? (snow that is)  I snowblowed over a foot before work and am currently at work  (out of the snowband right now to the north). But I know im going to return home to have to clean out another mess as its been snowing at the house all day!
We're buried here in Lancaster....snowblowed 3 times and shovel 3 times since 7am.....still coming down...Tundra pulled out 2 Dodge Rams, 3 Ford F150's and a crashed up Chevrolet....ha ha ha
No snow here in Hamilton.  It's tried a little but lake effect rarely affects us on the predomiately west winds. East winds, well that's another story.
its been snowing here on the lake since last night ...it is finally starting to accumulate as the ground is still soft...snow plow went by this morning but i havent fired up the blower as of yet...
Never happen.You probly need glasses,,,,,,,,,,It was probly those GMC trucks.

Going back home to the lancaster/depew area within the hour...........i left this morning with a foot on the ground and presuming we got another foot as i just checked snowfall totals and lancaster is at 24" ERGGGGG

Billy Bob.. you're so full of it ...  Been snowing here all night and all day.. wthell.. deal with it, I did. Moved 5 airplanes out and back in, as well as a boat and some other items during the worst of it. What's a boy to do.. we live in CANADA after all. Marty's out there tracking elvis in this crap.. .lol
not here ! we got 80nn of rain and heavy winds(car shelter ) But its comin' i can feel it in my bones
You should be a weatherman.LOL     So thats the name you gave that brute eh.  Long live Elvis til Satuday,LOL
Toronto seems a little damp today, but that's about it.
I'll bet ya forgot to add that you pulled them out all at once...I'll bet ya used a nylon rope cause a chain would be too heavy for your toy to carry....

REAL men use cables not chains....ever seen a chain break under stress....just like a bullet flying who knows where....  I have seen 3/4 inch chains break and even 1.25" cables break...but a cable gives you a warning.
Actually Brian, my friends Les Huemid and Sonny Brayks keep me posted on the weather
seems Lewiston as per its web cam got virtually no snow
you are right aniceguy no snow in lewiston but half hour down the road they got hammered

It snowed for around 18 hours at my house.  Live on the South Cheektowaga, Lancaster border.  Luckily my sons kept up with the snow removal since the college they attend was closed.  It is all luck of the draw or should I say direction of the wind when dealing with Lake Effect.
Wow and theres no houses on fire in the background or anything........surprising    (inside reference to another thread)
I live in Ontario's snow belt so I am very familiar with the term... I usually say it with the same intensity as a favourite 4 letter curse.

[Wow and theres no houses on fire in the background or anything........surprising   (inside reference to another thread)]  And no street people looking for cash.  Guess he has never ventured to Spaulding Lake in Clarence.
